ray.material

Interface Material

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Homogeneous, LambertianEmitter

    public interface Material
    A material is responsible for returning an emitted radiance and a BRDF at any point on a surface.
    Author:
    ags +latest $Author: srm $

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Material DEFAULT_MATERIAL
      The material given to all surfaces unless another is specified.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void emittedRadiance(LuminaireSamplingRecord lRec, Color outRadiance)
      Get the emitted radiance of this material at the location and direction described in lRec.
      BRDF getBRDF(IntersectionRecord iRec)
      Get the BRDF of this material at the intersection described in iRec.
      boolean isEmitter()
      Identify this material as emitting or not (for purposes of direct lighting).

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_MATERIAL

        static final Material DEFAULT_MATERIAL
        The material given to all surfaces unless another is specified.

    • Method Detail

      • getBRDF

        BRDF getBRDF(IntersectionRecord iRec)
        Get the BRDF of this material at the intersection described in iRec.
        Parameters:
        iRec - The intersection record, which holds the location, normal, etc.
        Returns:
        The BRDF for this material at this point

      • emittedRadiance

        void emittedRadiance(LuminaireSamplingRecord lRec,
                     Color outRadiance)
        Get the emitted radiance of this material at the location and direction described in lRec.
        Parameters:
        lRec - The luminaire sampling record. Within this structure, frame and emitDir are inputs to this method.
        outRadiance - The radiance emitted in that direction

      • isEmitter

        boolean isEmitter()
        Identify this material as emitting or not (for purposes of direct lighting).
        Returns:
        true if this material is emitter
